mdRecord.dcterms:medium: brick (clay product); Aquia Creek sandstone; stucco [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Monumental Church was built between 1812 and 1814 to commemorate the 72 people who died on the site in the December 26, 1811 Richmond Theatre fire. The building consists of two parts: a crypt and a church. The crypt is located beneath the sanctuary and contains the remains of those claimed by the fire. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monumental_Church [work]
